solution_line_template: Out of his {max_children} children, {children_with_different_num_grandchildren} have only 5 children so the rest who have 8 ( the same number as him) are {max_children}-{children_with_different_num_grandchildren} = <<{max_children}-{children_with_different_num_grandchildren}={children_with_same_num_grandchildren}>>{children_with_same_num_grandchildren}

{children_with_same_num_grandchildren} of Max's children have {grandchildren_per_same_child} children each for a total of {children_with_same_num_grandchildren}*{grandchildren_per_same_child} = <<{children_with_same_num_grandchildren}*{grandchildren_per_same_child}={grandchildren_from_same_children}>>{grandchildren_from_same_children} grandchildren

{children_with_different_num_grandchildren} of Max's children have {grandchildren_per_different_child} children each for a total of {grandchildren_per_different_child}*{children_with_different_num_grandchildren} = <<{grandchildren_per_different_child}*{children_with_different_num_grandchildren}={grandchildren_from_different_children}>>{grandchildren_from_different_children} grandchildren
